snippet: California, where half of the country’s electric cars are registered, is pushing for more, but as it is, too-few charging stations lead to fierce competition for available spots.
abstract: Dearth of electric car charging stations in California is frustrating drivers, in some cases prompting bad manners and arguments; adding to problem is wide variation in charging power and costs of a full charge at stations across state.
lead_paragraph: California, where half of the country’s electric cars are registered, is pushing for more, but as it is, too-few charging stations lead to fierce competition for available spots.

headline.main: In California, Electric Cars Outpace Plugs, and Sparks Fly
headline.print_headline: Electric Autos Outpace Plugs, and Sparks Fly
